intro: Manettia rojasiana, commonly known as the Colombian bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections.
